_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Grain and Field Bean Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy:  The management of this facility are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia through the use proper equipment, regular inspections, maintenance and training of all persons that work with anhydrous ammonia.  Should an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia occur, this facility has worked with the Burr oak, KS. Fire Department and Jewell County Local Emergency Planning Committee for emergency response to minimize the impact of the release on humans and the environment.
2.  Facility Information:  The Primary activity at this facility is the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is distributed for direct application to the soil as a crop nutrient.
3.  The facility has developed a worst-case and alternative case scenario.  As directed, these are withheld from the Executive Summary.
4.  Prevention Program:  This facility complies with the various Federal, State and Local rules and regulations, as well as applicable industry standards and guidelines regarding the storage, use and sale of anhydrous ammonia.
5.  Five-year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia at this facility in the past five years.
6.  Emergency Response Program:  Employees at this facility will not respond to emergencies.  This facility has an Emergency action plan.  Emergency response, community right to know information is coordinated with the State Emergency Response Commision and the Jewel County LEPC.
